titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Academy For Educational Development Records, 1956-1986
titlestmt.author: Processed by Hoover Institution Archives Staff; machine-readable finding aid created by Michael C. Conkin

publicationstmt.p: Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid derived from Word-11, a Unix VAX-specific word processing program. [Date of source: 1982.]

change.item: Revised to add pdf file of incremental material
Edited to add offsite storage note and updated code to OAC best practices

PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Academy For Educational Development Records)//EN" "reg_365.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

titlepage.titleproper: Inventory of the Academy For Educational Development Records, 1956-1986
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 1998, 2015 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Academy For Educational Development Records,
did.abstract: Correspondence, speeches, memoranda, minutes, financial records, reports, studies, bulletins, photographs, phonotapes, and videotapes, relating to education in the United States, particularly higher education; education in underdeveloped countries; and the use of communications technology in education

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is stored off-site. It may be possible to have a limited number of boxes brought to the archives reading room for examination. A minimum of two days notice is required. Please contact the Hoover Institution Archives for further information.

The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Academy For Educational Development Records, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1982 with subsequent increments.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Note
bioghist.p: American nonprofit institution for promotion of planning in education.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, speeches, memoranda, minutes, financial records, reports, studies, bulletins, photographs, sound recordings, and video tapes, relating to education in the United States, particularly higher education; education in underdeveloped countries; and the use of communications technology in education.
